title: Joe Sugg's desperate attempt to keep girlfriend Dianne Buswell and Dev Griffin in Strictly
text:
The video will start in 8 Cancel

Get the biggest Strictly Come Dancing stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

YouTube sensation Joe Sugg revealed he had voted for girlfriend Dianne Buswell and celebrity partner Dev Griffin 10 times to keep them in Strictly Come Dancing this weekend.

Having previously participated on the show himself, Joe, 28, shared a screenshot to his Instagram story which revealed his dedication to keep the couple in.

It appeared he had been calling the show's voting phone lines to vote for the pair over and over.

He wrote: "Spending the interval calling the same robot lady over and over," as he joked: "She's really polite".

Supportive Joe is on hand to help his girlfriend reach the Strictly final with Radio 1 DJ Dev Griffin, and it seems he really is doing all he can.

(Image: Instagram)

(Image: BBC/Guy Levy)

It comes after pro dancer Dianne and dance partner Dev have landed a space in the bottom two and will compete against Alex Scott and Neil Jones in tonight's results show.

The pair received a total score of 27 last night from the judges after they performed the Cha Cha Cha for week four, as the competition chunders on.

In a behind-the-scenes video clip before they performed, Dev revealed: "I haven't necessarily mastered the hip-rotation… I'm a hip apprentice, a hip-prentice."

(Image: Instagram)

Performing to Dancing With A Stranger by Sam Smith, the pair received mixed comments in feedback from the judges.

Craig Revel Horwood admitted: "The hips seemed to isolate quite nicely, but I want it to be a little be a bit cheekier, I wanted that personality… I thought the walks were slightly awkward."

Motsi was up next and said: "You better be careful of your focus, sometimes you focus so much on Dianne, we lose a bit of you in the dance."

(Image: BBC/Guy Levy)

While Bruno Tonioli added: "You don't quite know how to sell it yet."

Dianne recently admitted to Heart magazine that her hunky boyfriend "doesn't get jealous at all" when she's performing steamy routines with Dev.

And the red-haired beauty gave an example of why her beau Joe isn't jealous.

"I go into the living room every day to show him the progression of Dev and I's dances and he's like 'that's so good, do you think I could do that?'"

*Strictly Come Dancing returns next Saturday on BBC One
description: Supportive boyfriend Joe Sugg stepped in to help out his girlfriend and her dance partner
